title: CLEM and Super-Resolution Microscopy Pipeline Demonstrate Single Co-Releasing GABA-Glutamate Axon Terminals Establishing Convergent Synapses for Glutamate or GABA Release in Mouse Brain
content: We have previously discovered a subset of ventral tegmental area (VTA) neurons that co-expresses vesicular glutamate transport 2 (VGluT2) and vesicular GABA transporter (VGaT), and co-releases glutamate and GABA in the LHb [1]. To target these dual VTAVGluT2-VGaT neurons specifically, we developed transgenic mouse lines with dual recombinase and injected INTRSECT2.0 vectors into mouse VTA [2]. To examine the ultrastructural properties of axon terminals from these dual VTAVGluT2-VGaT neurons in the LHb, we employed a novel experimental pipeline combining (i) selective viral vector tracing, (ii) correlative light and electron microscopy (CLEM), and (iii) super-resolution microscopy. This allowed us to reconstruct distinct types of axon terminals containing both VGluT2 (associated with asymmetric synapses) and VGaT (associated with symmetric synapses).
